intro: Schrenkiella parvula, commonly known as the dwarf sandmat, is a small flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Schrenkiella parvula is well adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun.
